TopicTitle: So what did you name your space program?

Articles.Content:
What did you name your fictional space program/corporation? I named mine the Raketa Corporation for Space travel. (RCS)

Edited June 18, 2016 by The Flame Cat
made letters bold and larger
I never even consider a name for it. I guess "Kerbal Space Program"?
I started naming my career saves "KASA x" a while ago, x being the number of the career save that was. Not very original though.

Klandestinly Spirted Program

Klever Space Problems

or

Kerbal Sassy Products

or more usually Car1 Car2 etc. since they are easy to type.
I just named mine after fpdifferent real space agencies then got bored and named them after types of fish
I called my career Carrier.
Test Box. why? because when i first got into mods i mad a test save, and called it Test Box. ever since, ive rolled with it. not creative i know.

If my saves are for a specific limited purpose then I'll name them that.   But my main saves are R&D (for trying stuff, experimenting etc, and random mucking about) and PSA (Panda Space Agency) for 'serious' play.
KASA

My latest was started as FalconX as I initially intended to try and use recoverable rockets, sadly it proved to be a too much hassle given the returns and I gave up recovering stages not long after my first Mun landing.

I've rarely had a notional name for the whole space program as such, the only one that got an overall name was the Kethane Space Program, a career save I did mining and refining all my own fuel with the titular ISRU mod. Lots of flying around on Kerbin in that one.

My current install I call "100 Worlds", but that's not a name for the program itself, just a description of the modded solar system I run for it. I have names for individual programs - serieses of missions with something in common, like how we had Gemini and Apollo and STS in real life. But nothing for the whole thing or the space agency as it were.

Mostly this:

SkunkWorks (sandbox) for testing rocket designs.

Kerbal Space Patrol (career) for role playing my high tech program. Space Patrol uses flags of mythical animals for the different divisions. The four biggest divisions below.

skunk - contracts

turtle - roughnecks (mining)

rats - science bases and vehicles

fox - scouts/explorers

KIAA

Kerbal International Aerospace Administration.

RIMP

Rocket In My Pocket.

(Which always makes me chuckle because it sounds like a combination of rump and pimp.)

Edited June 5, 2016 by Rocket In My Pocket

ASI

Aurora Space Industries.

I sorta have a logo design, with a multicolored aurora that seems to come from the ground up, with a rocket in the center, and all the planets behind it in a curved line, and it's oval shaped.

Edited June 5, 2016 by Spaceception

I went for the Kerbin AeroSpace Exploration Initiative, or KASEI for short.  

I tacked on "Slightly Dangerous Division" for Science mode and "SDD Test Bed" for sandbox.
My save name is Aaaaaaaaaa but I think I just hit a random key repeatedly.

I have many different savegame names, but in my mind they all fall under NSP - Notebook Space Program. Mostly because I like notebooks. NSP also operates my real life space program (model rocketry) and my Minecraft Division (NSPM) and the Water Rocket Division, NOSPWRAD (NOtebook Space Program Water Rocketry Applications Division).

My save is called max_creative's save (I know so creative.) 

My space program is creativity aerospace. Slightly more creative.

Mine is named the "orbital operations program for science"

it made my wife laugh so I'm sticking with it.

15 hours ago, 5thHorseman said:

I never even consider a name for it. I guess "Kerbal Space Program"?

I'm gonna go with this.
Anoki Space Center.

Oh, I have several..,

My top three would be

Starlight Industries

Eclipse Technologies

Periapse Dynamics
I called it NASA 1. I'm creative!!
Made two flags for different programs. One for explorations and experiments, another one for rescue missions.
